A 50 kg skip attached to a steel rope on a crane is used to hoist bricks from the ground to the top of a construction site. The steel rope is wound onto a lifting drum with a diameter of 700 mm and rotational frequency of 49 revolutions per minute. The lifting drum is situated on the top floor which is 154 m high. How many seconds will it take to lift bricks, three quarters up the height of the building?

if you like me are here out of skepticism of a shitty rocket league youtubers observation that because hes shit at the game its impossible for the ball to curve you are correct he has fucking shit for brains and this video should make that very very clear how being unable to perform a task yourself does not make that task "impossible" you egotistical shit for brains moron.  thanks organic chemistry tutor I thought I was going crazy for a second.

so either professor sahi and this cc is a liar, or that rocket league player is lying straight to his audience face and using mass appeal to get away with it. (ie: we all say you are wrong and if you disagree you are delusional) well my last match was recorded and in it the ball "curved" either by accident or intentionally to my teams benefit, first the ball rotated from right to left while moving to the right and forward about 5-10yds, about 5ft in the air.  the second I rebounded the ball moving at about 10-15mph and struck it to give it a spin from right to left as I launched it about 40-60yrds towards the opposing goal, and as I intended, as the ball decended not in a straight line from where I struck it launching the ball forward but about 5-10 (15-20 would be quite a wide angle) degrees to the left of where it was originally launched to its trajectory. keep in note that draft plays 0 role in this virtual physical simulation however trajectory, impact, speed, position, accuracy, precision, as causes are, and this effects, ball height, ball trajectory, ball momentum, ball position, ball spin, and ball start and end locations.   some players believe that the ball can not be made to spin, either accidentally or otherwise.  I have multiple goals that say otherwise. but just to make sure im not crazy Im watching this video on rotation. because im pretty fucking sure the ball in rocket league spins and due to that spin the balls trajectory is not always a direct line with equal heights before and after its parabola.    the ball can infact start at one height and begin its decent at a much lower altitude due to the curvature of its flight path, due to the rotation effect described in this video also being accounted for in rocket league. if the ball is spinning and shot into the air it may not land directly across from where it was struck. hence, due to the rotation effect, the ball is caused to curve, and this can be used to manipulate its trajectory off an otherwise straightforward flightpath. don't flatearthhero this now. because he was made to look dumb for his ignorance quite easily. can I have 100k if I curve the ball in rocket league because it would really pay off some debts I have and help with my ambitions. of course I can, he will never pay.
